translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Buddha’s Chapter
The Buddha’s Birth Story

original: Namo tassa Bhagavato Arahato Sammāsambuddhassa.🔽Tathāgataṁ jetavane vasantaṁ,
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa  tathāgatam jetavane vasanta
translated: Homage to that Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One.
The Sage of Videha, with bowed body, asked the Realised One, dwelling in Jeta’s Wood,
“Are there said to be Omniscient Buddhas,

original: Bhavanti te hetubhi kehi vīra”.🔽Tadāha sabbaññuvaro mahesī,
analyzed: bhavanti te hetubhi kehi vīra  tat āha sabbaññu varaḥ mahesī
translated: What are the reasons for them, Hero?”
Then the Supreme One, the Omniscient One, the Great Seer, said to Ānanda, with a sweet voice,
“Those who have done what is right under the Buddhas of the past,
Who have not attained freedom in the Jina’s teachings,
Through that very door to Awakening, the wise ones,
Even through the great power of their aspirations,

analyzed: paññāya tejena su tikkha paññā  sabbaññu bhāvam anupāpuṇanti
translated: Through wisdom, energy, and their well-developed wisdom,🔽Attain the state of being an Omniscient One.
I, too, under the Buddhas of the past,
aspired to be a Supreme Buddha;
Having just made a mental aspiration,

analyzed: dhammarājā asaṅkhiyā  atha buddha apadānāni  suṇātha suddha mānasā
translated: to the King of Dhamma, beyond measure.🔽Then listen with a pure mind,🔽to the Buddha’s Birth Stories,
filled with the thirty perfections,
to the King of Dhamma, beyond measure.
To the Awakening of the Best of Buddhas,
with the Community, the Leaders of the World;
Having paid homage with ten fingers raised,
I bowed down to him with my head at his feet.
As many as the Buddha-fields,
The jewels that shine and are counted,
Those in the sky and on the ground,
I brought them all mentally.
There on the silver ground,
I had a palace built by me;
With many stories, made of jewels,
Towering up into the sky.
With various pillars, well-made,
Well-arranged, very valuable;
With a golden roof,
Adorned with jeweled eaves.
The first floor was of cat’s eye,
Pure and beautiful like a spotless crystal;
Filled with lotuses and water lilies,

analyzed: vara kañcana bhūmiyā  pavāḷasā pavāḷa vaṇṇā  kāci lohitakā subhā
translated: With a golden ground.🔽Some were of coral, the color of coral,🔽Some were beautiful with red arsenic;
Some had the color of sapphire,

analyzed: bhūmi obhāsatī disā  su vibhattā ghara mukhā
translated: The ground shone in all directions.🔽The house faces were well-arranged,
With windows and lion-shaped grilles;
The four railings were latticed,
With fragrant creepers delightful.🔽Blue, yellow, red,
White, and pure black,
With the appearance of a pavilion,

analyzed: oloka mayā padumā  vāḷa vihaṅga sobhitā
translated: Adorned with the seven treasures.🔽With lotuses made of crystal,🔽Adorned with peacocks and birds;
Filled with stars and constellations,
Adorned with the moon and sun.
Covered with a golden net,
With thousands of golden bells;
They resound with the speed of the wind,
Beautiful golden garlands.
The Mañjeṭṭhaka, the red,
The yellow, the brown;
Colored in various ways,
With a raised flag garland.

analyzed: na nam bahūn eka satā  phalikā rajata āmayā  maṇi mayā lohitaṅgā
translated: Not by many hundreds,🔽Silver pillows;🔽Gem-like, red-tinged,
And also made of coral;
Various kinds of beds,
Covered with fine linen.

analyzed: kampalā dukūlā cīnā  pattuṇṇā paṇḍu pāvurā
translated: Kampalā, dukūlā, cīnā,🔽Pattuṇṇā, paṇḍupāvurā;
All kinds of bedding,
I will mentally create.

analyzed: tāsu tāsu eva bhūmīsu  ratana kūṭalaṅkata
translated: On those very grounds,🔽Adorned with heaps of jewels;
The light of precious gems,
Shining brightly.🔽The pillars and crossbeams shine,
The beautiful golden archways;
The Jambu River, made of essence,

analyzed: atha u rajata mayā api ca
translated: And also made of silver.
Many well-proportioned joints,
Decorated with door panels and bolts;

analyzed: ubhatas puṇṇa ghaṭā anekā  paduma uppala sayutā
translated: Many full jars on both sides,🔽Filled with lotuses and blue lotuses.
And to all the Buddhas of the past,
And the Community, the Leader of the World;
Having created a form with the characteristics of the Pāṭihāriya,
Together with the disciples.
Having entered by that door,
All the Buddhas together with the disciples;
Seated on a golden throne,
In the noble circle.
And those who are at present,
The unsurpassed Buddhas in the world;
And those who have been in the past,
All ascended the Mansion.
And many hundreds of Independent Buddhas,
The Self-Arisen, the Unconquered;
And those who have been in the past, and those who are in the present,
All ascended the Mansion.
There are many wish-fulfilling trees,
Which are divine and human;
Having collected all the cloth,

analyzed: acchādemi ti cīvara  khajjam bhojjam sāyanīya
translated: I made three robes.🔽Food to chew and to suck, and food to drink,
Which is excellent drink and food;
Having filled up a beautiful golden bowl,
I gave it to them.

analyzed: dibbavattha samāḥ hutvā  maṭṭhā cīvara sayutā  madhurā sakkharā ca iva
translated: Having become like divine cloth,🔽Shining and endowed with robes;🔽Sweet and sour,
And oil, honey and molasses.
Having been prepared by the Supreme Man,
All of them in the noble circle;
Having entered the Jetavana Monastery,
Like a lion in a cave.
On a very valuable bed,🔽they lay down in the lion’s posture.
With full awareness they got up
and sat cross-legged on the bed.
The domain of all Buddhas,
they were absorbed in the bliss of meditation.
Some taught the Teaching,
some played with psychic powers.
Some were intent on higher knowledge,
having mastered the higher knowledges.
They performed miracles,
some in one thousand worlds.
The Buddhas asked the Buddhas,
the sphere of the All-Seeing One,
The deep and subtle state,
they awakened to with wisdom.
The disciples asked the Buddhas,
the Buddhas asked the disciples.
Having asked each other,
they explained to each other.
The Buddhas, the Independent Buddhas,
the disciples, and the attendants,
Thus they delighted in their own way,
they delighted in the palaces.
Let the parasols remain, made of jewels,🔽with golden handles,
surrounded by nets of pearls,
may they all hold them over their heads.

analyzed: bhavantu ceḍa vitānā  sa uṇṇa tāraka citti tā
translated: Let there be canopies,🔽adorned with golden stars,
covered with variegated garlands,

analyzed: sabbe dhārentu matthake  vitatā malya dāmā ihi  gandha dāmehi sobhitā
translated: May all of them hold it on their heads.🔽Hung with garlands of flowers,🔽adorned with garlands of perfume;
Surrounded by garlands of cloth,
decorated with garlands of jewels.
Covered with beautiful flowers,
adorned with sweet scents;
Made of five-colored incense,
covered with a golden canopy.
In the four directions of the lotus pond,
covered with lotuses and water lilies;
May golden figures appear,
with the color of lotus pollen.
May all the trees bloom,
all around the palace;
And having released the flowers themselves,
they went to the palace and worshipped.

analyzed: sikhinaḥ tattha naccantu  dip bahasā pakūjare
translated: May peacocks dance there,🔽and wild geese cry out in the sky;
And may the cuckoos sing,

original: dijasaṅghā samantato.🔽Bheriyo sabbā vajjantu,🔽vīṇā sabbā rasantu tā;
analyzed: dija saṅghā  bheriyaḥ sabbāḥ vajjantu  vīṇā sabbā rasantu tā
translated: and flocks of celestial beings all around.🔽May all the drums sound,🔽and all the lutes play;
May all the music play,
all around the palace.
As far as the Buddha-field,
beyond the iron-wheel;
Great and endowed with light,
unbroken, made of jewels.
May golden couches stand,
and the oil-lamps shine there;
May they all be one light,
in the ten-thousand world system.

analyzed: gaṇikā lāsikā ca iva  naccantu accharāgaṇā
translated: Courtesans and prostitutes,🔽and the hosts of celestial nymphs dance;
Multi-coloured banners will be seen
all around the palace.
On the mountain ridge, on the mountain peak,
on the top of Mount Sineru;
I hoist a flag everywhere,
variegated with five colours.
Men, elephants, and gandhabbas,
all the gods come to you;
Paying homage with hands cupped in reverence,
they surround the palace.
Whatever wholesome deeds,
whatever actions are to be done by me;
By body, speech, and mind,
may the well-done be done.
Whatever beings there are with perception,

original: ye ca sattā asaññino;🔽Kataṁ puññaphalaṁ mayhaṁ,
analyzed: ye ca sattāḥ asaññino  katam puñña phalam
translated: and whatever beings are without perception;
May they all share in the fruit of my merit.
For those who know what is done,
the gift and the fruit of merit by me;
And for those who do not know there,
the gods went and informed them.
Whatever beings there are in the whole world,
who live for the sake of food;
May they all obtain every kind of fine food,
by my intention.
I gave gifts with my mind,
I generated confidence with my mind;
I worshipped all the Buddhas,
the Paccekabuddhas and the Buddhas’ disciples.
By that good deed well done,
by my intention and aspiration;
Having abandoned the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
I know two existences,
among the gods and among humans;
I do not know another destination,
the fruit of my aspiration with my mind.
I am superior to the gods,
I become the lord of men;
Endowed with the characteristics of beauty,

analyzed: paññāya asamaḥ bhave  bhojanam vividham seṭṭha
translated: I am unequalled in wisdom in existence.🔽Various kinds of excellent food,
and immeasurable jewels;

original: Vividhāni ca vatthāni,🔽Nabhā khippaṁ upenti maṁ.
analyzed: vividhāni ca vatthāni  nabhā khippam upenti ma
translated: And various kinds of garments,🔽quickly come to me from the sky.
On the earth, on the mountains,
in the sky, in the water, in the forest;
Wherever I stretch out my hand,
divine food comes to me.
On the earth, on the mountains,
in the sky, in the water, in the forest;
Wherever I stretch out my hand,
all jewels come to me.
On the earth, on the mountains,
in the sky, in the water, in the forest;
Wherever I extend my hand,
all scents come to me.
On the plains and on the mountains,
in the sky, in the water, in the forest;
Wherever I extend my hand,
all vehicles come to me.
On the plains and on the mountains,
in the sky, in the water, in the forest;
Wherever I extend my hand,
all garlands come to me.
On the plains and on the mountains,
in the sky, in the water, in the forest;
Wherever I extend my hand,
all ornaments come to me.
On the plains and on the mountains,
in the sky, in the water, in the forest;
Wherever I extend my hand,
all maidens come to me.
On the plains and on the mountains,
in the sky, in the water, in the forest;
Wherever I extend my hand,
honey and sugar come to me.
On the plains and on the mountains,
in the sky, in the water, in the forest;
Wherever I extend my hand,
all edibles come to me.
To the poor, the indebted,
and the beggars who come along,
I give this excellent gift,
for the attainment of supreme enlightenment.
I will make the mountain rock,🔽I will make the great mountain roar;
I will make the world with its gods laugh,
I will become a Buddha in the world.
In the ten directions of the world,
there is no end to the extent;
And in that direction,
there are innumerable Buddha-fields.
My radiance is spread out,
the two Yāmas are my vehicle for pleasure;
In between that net of rays,
there will be vast light.
In this entire world system,
may all people see me;
May all follow me,
as far as the Brahmanical abode.
With the sound of the Visuddhimagga,
I beat the drum of the Deathless;
In between that, all people,
may they hear the sweet voice.
With the rain of the Dhamma cloud,
may all be free from defilements;
May those beings who are last here,
may they become Stream-Enterers.
Having given the gift that should be given,
having fulfilled virtue in all ways;
Having gone to the perfection of renunciation,
I have attained the supreme enlightenment.
Having asked the wise ones,
having made supreme effort;
Having reached perfection in patience,
I attained supreme Awakening.
Having made a firm resolve,
and fulfilled the perfection of truth,
Having reached perfection in loving kindness,
I attained supreme Awakening.
In gain and loss, in pleasure and pain,
in honour and in dispraise,
Being the same in all things,
I attained supreme Awakening.

analyzed: kosajjam bhayataḥ disvā  vīriyam ca api khemataḥ
translated: Seeing sloth as fearful🔽and energy as safe,
Be energetic,
this is the instruction of the Buddhas.
Seeing conflict as fearful
and non-conflict as safe,
Be harmonious and friendly,

analyzed: esā buddha anusāsanī  pamādam bhayataḥ disvā
translated: this is the instruction of the Buddhas.🔽Seeing negligence as fearful
and heedfulness as safe,
Develop the eightfold path,
this is the instruction of the Buddhas.
Many Buddhas have come together,
and all the Worthy Ones as well;
Paying homage to the Buddhas and Worthy Ones,
bow down in reverence.
Thus the Buddhas are inconceivable,
the qualities of the Buddhas are inconceivable;
For those with confidence in the inconceivable,
the result is inconceivable.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ bhagavā attano buddhacariyaṁ sambhāvayamāno buddhāpadāniyaṁ nāma dhammapariyāyaṁ abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam bhagavā attanaḥ buddha cariyam sambhāvayamānaḥ buddhāpadāniyam nāma dhammapariyāyam abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus did the Exalted One, extolling his own career as a Buddha, relate to the monks this discourse on the Law, entitled “The Buddha’s Recollections.”
The Buddha’s Recollections is concluded.
